replies.msg:
We have five demands. Withdrawal of the amendment bill is only one of them. The five demands are:
1. Full withdrawal of the extradition bill
2. A commission of inquiry into alleged police brutality
3. Retracting the classification of protesters as “rioters”
4. Amnesty for arrested protesters
5. Dual universal suffrage for both the Legislative Council and
the Chief Executive
The 2nd, 3rd, and the 4th demands arise because the government refused to withdraw the bill amendment after a marching of 1 million Hong Kong people. The 5th demand is the ultimate solution of the turmoil in Hong Kong.
Now the government withdraws the bill, and it is not a concession at all. It’s only a tactic of the government trying to kill the movement by the people.

FIVE DEMANDS NOT ONE LESS

Fight for Freedom, stand with Hong Kong

Tiananmen Square, Never Again

5 demands, not one less

condemn police brutality

shame on Hong Kong police

No sexual violence

è‹±æ–‡æ–‡å®£å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼ˆå¤§å®¶æœ‰å…¶ä»–å¥½æ–‡å®£åœ–è«‹ç•™è¨€æä¾›ï¼‰ï¼š
Put the bill Withdrawal in motion (after summer break of Legco in Oct) is only a mean to create a rift between frontliners and peacemakers.
Moreover, millions of citizens have come out to express their dissatisfaction towards the current political system and the performance of the government. Yet, the government chose to shift the responsibility of the political turmoil to the protesters and condemned violence selectively. They are turning a blind eye to the voice of the people, while pandering to the “white terror” and police brutality in Hong Kong.
What's the difference between the withdrawals of June 9th and September 4th? It's that the latter was through our companions' blood:
- 2 terrorist attacks in MTR(Yuen Long, Prince Edward)
- Attacks with knives causing severe injury in 2 people
- 9 losses of life
- Sexual assault of our female fighters
- Tear gas abuse on citizens and in MTR
- over 1000+ arrests
- 100+ prosecutions
- 6 cerebral bleeding
- 30+ broken bones
- Uncountable injuries and exiles
This doesn't count #metoo and the people who have yet to speak out, so we cannot stop here!
And just from that, the difference is clear, and the immorality of the entire police force and administration is very obvious. All five core demands must be met, and none can be left out!
1. Withdrawal of the Extradition Bill in its entirety
2. Establishment of an Independent Commission of Inquiry into alleged police brutality
3. Immediate release of exoneration of all protestors
4. Retracting the classification of protesters as “rioters”
5. Real Universal Suffrage of the Chief Executive and Legislative Council.
And we must all remember the fighters we have lost in the movement.
Mr. Hong KJ(25) - 15/12/2017
Mr. Leung JK(35) - 15/6/2019
Ms. Lu XY(21) - 30/6/2019
Zhita Wu(29) - 30/6/2019
Ms. Mak(28) - 3/7/2019
Mr. Mui(32) - 5/7/2019
Mr. Fan(26) - 22/7/2019
Mr. Calvin Kwok - 27/8/2019
Mr. Ki (16) - 2/9/2019
#5DemandsNot1less
Free Hong Kong, Pass the Act
